answer: Where are they?

question: Okay, they're probably there, but you'll never see them. They're far off, too far for you to get there.
answer: But what if they try to find me?

question: They won't. They hate you too.
answer: But what if they don't? What if they love me but I hate them?

question: Well then you're just... you'll both be fine with it. There's only love there, okay? But why would you eat bad flavors? Well don't eat it then! Well don't put it on then! What's wrong with you people? I mean... A terrible place. The worst place imaginable. Murder. Crime. Rape. Things like that. Fine. Yes. Then it's fine. No. That's fine too. I mean, you might lose your job if your boss doesn't like it, but it won't effect what happens after you die. That also is fine. Unless the dog dies. Then it's bad. No. You get... ... three chances. If you do three bad things you're out. Kind of, yes. Any more? Look, can we just move on? Fine. Let's start with you... No. There's no hairstyle that will put you in the bad place. Like I've told you, the main things are hurting people physically on purpose, taking people's stuff, doing things to people they don't want done, killing people on purpose. Okay? Are we good? Well, you didn't know about these bad things until I told you just now so you're fine. You're all fine! I'm only talking about people who do bad things starting right now. Everyone else is fine. Yes. Yes.
answer: Did he cause that tree to land on my car last week?

question: I don't know, he forgot or something. I gotta go people, good night! You think that went well? So then the flying duck flew all the way to Alaska where it met up with a polar bear who could talk. And the polar bear's name was Martin. And the polar bear was wearing a green cape. And Martin and the flying duck both had race cars with their names printed on the side and...
answer: I just saw three people climbing the fence into your backyard. You really need to think about getting better security. (noticing beer cans

question: (continuing; glaring at Yeah. Hey, don't look at me Yeah. Tell them to shoot that one this week. What?
answer: You haven't left the house in weeks. Every time I come by you're just sitting here writing down stories you get from the Man in the Sky.

question: Hey, he's the boss.
answer: Don't you think you should go outside sometime? You know there's about five thousand people on our lawn waiting to ask you questions.

question: Yeah, yeah.
answer: What's with you? You seem sad. I don't get it. You're a very successful writer, you've won countless awards and Oscars... You've changed the way people see the world, the way they see death and life. You've made the entire world happy.

question: Not the entire world.
answer: I know. Not you. The one person who should be happy, the person who has everything... What else do you want?

question: I'd trade it all in for you. All of it.
answer: Well, you've got me. As a friend.

question: Yeah. That's important.
answer: Because of the whole snub nosed thing. With kids, your genetics. You know, fat, short...

question: Yeah. Okay. Yup.
answer: What?

question: It would be great if it changed your genetic material because I really love you but I just don't... It does change your genetics.
answer: Does it?

question: No. No, it doesn't. Our kids would be short and fat with little snub noses.
answer: Right. Too bad.

question: Why not?
answer: I've got a date.

question: What? With who?
answer: Rob Marlowe.

question: You've got to be fucking... Rob Marlowe?!? He's a complete and total asshole.
answer: Not to me. He's very sweet and kind to me.

question: Well of course he is, look at you. I mean, for fuck's sake, a shark would be nice to you...
answer: It would?

question: Well no, I mean...
answer: Why not? He's a great match for me.

question: What's he got that I don't?
answer: We talked about this. If you and I got together it wouldn't be fair to our kids. They have the right to be attractive and have good genes.

question: I don't want to move into your fucking mansion. And what are you doing thinking about marriage with him already? You haven't even gone on one date. It's like nothing's changed.
answer: A lot of things have changed. I wish you could be happy. That's him. Gotta go.

question: He's picking you up here?
answer: It was his idea.

question: Who was that?
answer: Hey, watch this. HEY PEOPLE! The man in the sky just told me something! You're all gay! And adopted!

question: I don't know why we're laughing. It's really probably very sad for those people.
answer: I'm gettin' a beer. Out of beer. Just Coke. I want to do something big again. Like telling the people what happens when they die. That felt good. I gotta do something big like that again.

question: Maybe the Man in the Sky will tell you something new.
answer: Maybe.

question: Ugh, this shit is so bad for you. I really shouldn't drink this.
answer: Hey, Greg. What if I told you that drinking Coke was good for you? And not just Coke. But all the delicious foods you're not supposed to eat. What if they were all of a sudden really, really good for you?

question: It would be the happiest day of my life.
answer: Gentleman, thank you all for coming here on such short notice. I have some very big news for you all today. Nope, this one I came up with all on my own. And it's going to change the way you all do business... forever. Up until now, all products sold worldwide have warning labels printed on them. Warnings like these. As you can see, a lot of these products can be very depressing. They remind people of all the horrible things that can happen to them in life. People hate thinking about horrible things. Hear me out, fellas. Allow me to introduce you to the future of your companies. It's the same Coke as before. Guys, it's the same Coke on the inside. I've just changed the outside. I didn't do anything, guys. I made this on my computer last night. The plane is exactly the same as it was before. That's the point here guys. With these new advertising strategies, people will buy your products with abandon. No. It won't. All you have to do is print these words on the packaging. That's it. Even if you don't understand it, just start shipping these products out to people as you see them here and you're all going to get very, very rich. Look, they're still the same products you have on the shelves right now. The only difference now is that people won't get bummed out or scared when they use them. Isn't that a good thing? Gentleman, if you'll excuse me, I have five thousand gay orphans on my front lawn that are going bananas. You should slow down there, Greg.

question: Why's that?
answer: Just because the package says it's not bad for you doesn't mean you have to gorge yourself on it.

question: But it tastes so good.
answer: That's just stupid.

question: No it's not. See? You look sad. Here, have a brownie. They'll cheer you up.
answer: I wish that worked for me, Greg.

question: What?
answer: Nevermind. I'll see you around. Yeah. So are you going to apologize? Nothing's really changed. I gave people the Man in the Sky, made myself rich and successful, told the world they can eat whatever they want and feel good about it. Everyone's happy but me. Because I'm the only one who knows it all... isn't. I made it all up. Who's there?

question: Nevermind. I'll see you around. Yeah. So are you going to apologize? Nothing's really changed. I gave people the Man in the Sky, made myself rich and successful, told the world they can eat whatever they want and feel good about it. Everyone's happy but me. Because I'm the only one who knows it all... isn't. I made it all up. Who's there?
answer: It's me. Can I come in?

question: Sure. Haven't seen you much lately.
answer: I know. I've been busy with work and things. And I'm getting married. That's why I came over. To tell you.

question: Don't do it.
answer: The wedding is tomorrow. I hope you'll come.

question: No point really.
answer: It would make me happy. Being around you makes me happy.

question: So don't marry him.
answer: I only have a few years to marry someone with good genes and financial stability so I can have children and the family I've always wanted. One day I'll be old and wrinkly and ugly.

question: No you won't. Not to me you won't. I love you. If you really love someone it doesn't matter what they look like.
answer: What do you mean?

question: Do me this favor. Just one favor. Don't accept everything you see. Don't just do something because that's the way it's done.
answer: You're confusing me.

question: Think about what you want. Find out what you really want. And if it's not the same as what I want, well then I'll know that and I'll never darken your doorstep again.
answer: I'm going to go.

question: Me.
answer: Oh come on. Look at you. You can't be better.

question: Yes I can. You've got shmuck genes.
answer: Schmuck genes? What's that?

question: What?
answer: I'm confused.

question: So am I.
answer: Is any of it... the things you said... are they... I can't think of the word.

question: No.
answer: Why'd you say there was?

question: Because I couldn't cope with the look on my grandmother's face.
answer: But how could you say something that... wasn't.

question: I'm not sure. I just did it.
answer: And what did you mean that I could grow old and ugly and still be beautiful to you?

question: I mean just that. You'll always be beautiful to me.
answer: But what if my looks...

question: It doesn't matter.
answer: I feel funny.

question: Me too.
answer: I know what I want.

question: What?
answer: I want short, fat kids with little snub noses. Does anyone else know about your invention?

question: No. But I'm sure it won't be long.
answer: Should we tell them right away?
